response.overview: Free fall experiences are of extreme interest to me as a filmmaker due to altered visual perceptual parameters. The more or less uncontrolled dynamics of a falling camera generate unexpected views of our familiar environment. In my one-minute video, I tried to compose shots of cameras being thrown into the air into a fast-paced free-fall ballet. Conventional ways of looking at the use of architecture are broken up and well-known horizons are eliminated. A new perspective unfolds in the energy of these camera movements.
response.title: Thrown
